page.title: 13THE WATERFRONT COMPLEX HULL
page.content: On the side of Princes dock there is a large very old warehouse, it was once derilict with no roof and infected with rot and insects. The building was finished in 1831 and called Wilberforce Warehouses but had not been used since 1957. In 1977 a local businessman, Francis Daly, negotiated a long lease on the building and set about making the building weather- tight. Inside the complex the old wood and brickwork has been retained to give the place a rustic feel. The first part of complex to open was the nightclub and this financed the development of the Waterfront Hotel, the Roof Garden Restaurant and the Cellar Bar. The complex has won many national and international awards including the Civic Trust Award and the Europa Nostra award.
